results.title: Sculpture Australia '69
results.brief_description: Australian sculptors discuss their attitudes towards modern sculpture. Artists shown at work include Norma Redpath creating the fountain for the Commonwealth Treasury, Steven Walker, Ken Reinhart, Robert Klippel, Clement Meadmore and Vincent Jomantis

results.title: Scrubbers
results.creator_credit: HandMade Films, Don Boyd and Mai Zetterling
results.brief_description: Swedish director Mai Zetterling filmed this tense and realistic drama set in Borstal Women’s Goal using a cast of mostly unknown young actors. The film powerfully portrays the dehumanising experiences the mostly young offenders undergo in prison but it does so without resorting to exploitation of the women or a glorification of violence. Instead Zetterling focuses on the friendships formed by the women within prison. “Scrubbers” is unavoidably confronting and disturbing - but it is also a prison film with a refreshing sense of dignity.

results.title: Scrooge McDuck and money (K)
results.brief_description: The history and value of money is retold in an amusing and entertaining manner to three young ducks by their wealthy uncle Scrooge McDuck. The wise old man also offers advice on budgeting and taxes.

results.title: Scrooge
results.creator_credit: Cinema Center Films, Robert H Solo and Ronald Neame
results.brief_description: This musical version of Charles Dickens’ timeless and beloved story is a lavish and lively production starring Albert Finney. Ebenezer Scrooge, the miserable old miser, takes a frightening journey through Christmas Past, Present and Yet to Come. He realizes there is still hope for his salvation on Christmas Day. He dons a Father Christmas costume and visits the home of Bob Cratchit, his loyal employee, to spread his new-found joy to the whole family, especially Tiny Tim. Music by Leslie Bricusse.

results.title: Scribbling kitten
results.brief_description: A kitten named Miaow draws on Mr Bear’s wall watched by two mice friends. When Miaow is finally caught he has to wash the drawings off the wall but when the two mice decide to interfere, the chase is on.

results.title: Screwcutting
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions and K. Baron Hartley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lathework series”.
The film starts with a short general discussion of screw threads, pitch and shape. The principle of the screw-cutting lathe is illuatrated by mounting a wooden cylinder in the lathe and using a lead pencil instead of a cutting tool.
